chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent Davis Nelson, #367365 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid through Probation.
Must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge of $300.
May not use/possess firearms or body armor.

May not vote until civil rights are restored.  
May not hold elected office and other rights may be lost until restroed. 
If not a US citizen may face deportation.

Must follow orders set forth in 13CV481 and 13CV483.
Compas and comply with recommendations.
May have contact by telephone and/or at the jail - once released from custody it will be at the discretion of the Probation agent and orders of the court whether contact can/will remain or a no contact will be in place with Kelly Nelson.

CASES: 13CF433, 14CF196 & 14CF314. Defendant Brent Davis Nelson in court with attorney Kathleen Mary Gionis.  Defendant Brent Davis Nelson in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 11:24 am.  

SENTENCING - 13CF433/14CF196-Exh 1 & Exh 2-O&R.  CT finds elig for SA pgm.  

13CF433-count 1-Order 6 yr WST, 3 yr IC & 3 yr ES, Stay, probation up to 3 yrs.  Conditions-follow orders set forth in 13CV481 & 13CV483-Polk County.  Telephone contact or contact while at the jail - once released at descretion of probation & subj to orders of court w/ Kelly Nelson except as allowed by Probation & Parole.  DNA sample/surcharge.  NO firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, no body armor, cannot hold elected office & other rights may be lost until restored, if not US citizen face deportation.  9 mo CT starting today, subj to WR no GT.  $290.60 fine/costs thru probation. Find 159 days credit.

14CF196-w/h sentence, probation up to 3 yrs - concurrent w/ other file.  Same conditions.  COMPAS & follow recomm.  Order 6 mo CT in 196 - stayed for use by probation, subj to WR.  Find 159 days credit.  $290.60 fine/costs pay through probation.  DNA sample/surcharge-$300.

CASES: 13CF433, 14CF196 & 14CF314.  Defendant Brent Davis Nelson in court with attorney Kate Murtaugh by telephone WLC appearing for attorney Gionis.  Defendant Brent Davis Nelson in custody.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 1:56 pm.  CT denies request to modify bond.  Bond cont.  2:02 pm adj.
Case Reassignment Order.

Bond converts to Signature bond at 10:00 am on 7/31/14 to allow defendant to be released to Wesley Nelson or Beth Nelson to attend txt.  If defendant leaves for any reason, defendant must immediately report to the Polk County Jail.  Contact only by phone with Kelly Nelson regarding the children.   Must appear at all future court appearances.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.  Not to commit any new crimes.  Defendant shall neither directly or indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.
